node.title: NSW Deputy Premier Paul Toole to call on colleagues to rule out new coal exploration zones
node.alt: Cows grazing in a paddock with large cliffs in the background.
node.description: NSW Deputy Premier Paul Toole says he will be asking colleagues to oppose a proposal to open up new areas for coal exploration.
node.content:
["The New South Wales Deputy Premier, Paul Toole, says he does not support the creation of new coal exploration zones in the state's central west, and will recommend his government does not either.", "The Hawkins and Rumker areas, north of Rylstone, have been earmarked by the state government for new coal mines.\u00a0", "About 30,000 hectares of land has been identified as potentially suitable for exploration", "Public consultation on the proposal began in June, before Mr Toole took over from the former Nationals leader,\u00a0John Barilaro.", "More than 2500 public submissions were received, of which just 15 were supportive of the plan to create new exploration zones.", "It comes amid plans to halve carbon emissions in NSW by 2030.\u00a0", "", "
The proposal would see areas in the NSW central west opened for tenders for coal exploration.(Supplied: NSW Government)
", "Today, Mr Toole told a budget estimates hearing at state parliament he would\u00a0ask the cabinet not to support the project.", "Community opposition to the project is strong, and Greens MP Cate Faehrmann said a ute muster protest had been planned.", "Ms Faehrmann asked Mr Toole if he had planned to announce his opposition to the proposal before today's hearing.", "\"I formed a view before budget estimates in relation to that particular project,\"\u00a0he responded.", "", "
There is significant community opposition to the proposal, with the hearing told a protest is planned for this weekend.(ABC Central West: Hugh Hogan)
", "Mr Toole described the area, some of which was in his electorate of Bathurst, as \"beautiful\", and said he regularly drove\u00a0through it.", "\"This still fits in line with our government's commitment to future of coal statement\u00a0\u2014\u00a0acknowledging that coal needs to be put into those areas that are appropriate.", "
Aimed for export
", "The Hawkins and Rumker areas are two of eight zones earmarked by the state government which could potentially become new coal mines.\u00a0", "If the Department of Planning, Industry and Environment's (DPIE) Advisory Board gave the proposal the green light, Mr\u00a0Toole could\u00a0ask companies to tender for rights to discover how resource-rich the area was.\u00a0", "The\u00a0zones are the first to go through the 'strategic coal release areas' which aims to ensure the fossil fuel industry continues to provide jobs to regional areas.\u00a0", "The plan by the NSW Government said the state \"is well placed to meet the demand for coal from countries at our doorstep\" but the global phasing out of the resource \"will take some decades to complete\".\u00a0", "The coal eventually mined from the new release zones was tipped for export markets, primarily Asian countries such as China and South Korea.\u00a0"]
